metadata.dc:author: Hueso Pérez, J
Sánchez Rodríguez, A
de Portugal Alvarez, J
Pérez Sandoval, D
Sánchez Fuentes, D
Mejía Molina, P
Criado Jiménez, M
Rico Sánchez, J
metadata.dc:description: The seric activity of the enzyme NAG (N-acetyl-beta-D-glucosaminidase) was studied in 3 groups of patients with jaundice of different etiology (extrahepatic, intrahepatic and acute hepatitis) and in a control group, in order to observe the discrimination capacity of this enzyme in each group. After the use of a fluorimetric method, the results were exposed, applying the statistical test, comparing different variables; the results are discussed and we conclude that NAG is an enzyme of easy detection and low cost to be included in the group of tests to study the biological pattern of jaundice.
metadata.dc:title: Estudio del enzima N-acetil-B-D-glucosaminidasa en el síndrome ictérico.
[N-acetyl-beta-D-glucosaminidase in jaundice syndrome].
